ABOUT US

This is the official page for the Developer's Community of IIT Bombay. Envisioned as the group of best developers of the Institute, the team is responsible for developing and maintaining InstiApp, and other dev/tech related projects in the Institute.

Projects

Envisioned as the group of best developers of the Institute, the team is responsible for developing and maintaining InstiApp, Cerium and RPI Noticeboard and many other dev/tech related projects. Details regarding each of them can be accessed below.

Mess Menu

The mess menu for all hostels is available as a list (with the user’s hostel’s current day menu occupying the top position)

Calendar

The Calendar for the major bodies (Cult/Tech/any other body with a public calendar) will be available under this heading.

Timetable

The user can create his academic timetable (manually, by adding courses) within the app itself. User will get an option to select predefined slots based on the Institute TImetable

Events Feed

The main feed will have only updates from Users and Entities that a User follows.

Placement Blog

The Placement/Training blog is available inside the app with the option to get notifications for All posts / posts with certain keywords.

Map

The institute map along with current position and all currently active events visible as clickable icons.

Development

Run yarn to install dependencies. Start the golang backend on port 8000 and use yarn run start to start the development server.

Build

Run 'yarn build' in your root directory to create a production ready build.

License

All code is licensed under the Mozilla Public License 2.0.

Description

Cerium is a forms application very similar in design to Google forms. The backend for the application is go-cerium.

Go Cerium

go-cerium is the golang backend for the dangerously accurate Google Forms clone designed for IIT Bombay, cerium.

Go Cerium Development

Install dependencies using 'dep ensure' and run the backend with 'go run main.go'. You need to have mongodb running and environment variables set correctly in .env.

File: config.json

Helps you define the configuration for how you want the images to appear on the TV.

File: fetch.py

A Python script that runs in the background and periodically fetches images from the server. We set up a cron job for this.

File: gui.py

The main script that runs on boot and occupies the foreground. This displays the images on the TV.

Description

Scripts to fetch and display images on a TV and also allows users to setup configuration how you want the images to appear on the TV.

Setup

Install a standard Raspbian OS on the RPi and configure the RPi to connect to internet. Follow the steps in README.md of the RPi Noticeboard github repo.

Features

Bash Scripting, Python Scripts, and JSON Configuration files to fetch and show images of your choice on TV.
